Class Monster

java.lang.Object
  Monster

public class Monster
extends java.lang.Object

Class to model a Monster that runs around the screen.

Version:
4/25/13
Author:
Julie Workman

Field Detail

direction

public PVector direction
A Processing Vector object to store the direction of the Monster. PVectors have an x and a y component of their direction.

x

public double x
The x location of the Monster.

y

public double y
The y location of the Monster.

Constructor Detail

Monster

public Monster(double x,
               double y)
Constructor for objects of class Monster. Set the x and y location of the Monster. Set the intial direction to the PVector(0,0) indicating that the Monster is not moving.

Parameters:
x - the initial x location of the Monster
y - the initial y location of the Monster
Method Detail

draw

public void draw()
Method to draw the Monster.

Renders the Monster on the screen at the correct location. The Monster must not take up more than 50x50 pixels.

getX

public double getX()
Method to access the x location of the Monster

Returns:
the x location of the Monster

getY

public double getY()
Method to access the y location of the Monster

Returns:
the y location of the Monster

move

public void move()
Method to move the Monster.

Adds the direction PVector to the x and y location of the Monster.

setDirection

public void setVector(PVector direction)
Method to set the direction of the Monster

Parameters:
direction - the direction of the Monster represented as a PVector
